channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Evercade's retro game cartridge system now has a home console
item.description: UK-based company Blaze Entertainment has launched Evercade VS, a follow-up to the Evercade handheld retrogaming console it released last year.

item.title: Yoto is a podcast and audiobook machine built for kids
item.description: Kids can enjoy audiobooks and podcasts too thanks to the child-friendly Yoto Player and its library.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Apple’s AirTags and, yes, the purple iPhone
item.description: This week, Cherlynn and Devindra chat with Engadget’s Chris Velazco about Apple’s AirTags and the new purple iPhone. We dive into what it’s like to use the AirTags to find things, and their potential limitations.

item.title: How to order Apple AirTags
item.description: Here's how to order Apple's AirTags, plus more information on when you can buy the new Apple iMac, iPad Pro and Apple TV 4K.

item.title: The 2020 iPad Pro is at an all time low as 2021 pre-orders open
item.description: The 12.9-inch 2020 iPad Pro with LTE is now on sale for $1,000, or $250 off the regular price -- the best deal we've seen yet.

item.title: The Morning After: Testing Apple's AirTags
item.description: Today’s headlines: CD Projekt Red made hundreds of millions on 'Cyberpunk 2077' made hundreds of millions despite the refunds, Signal hacked some Cellebrite’s phone hacking software used by law enforcement and the next version of iOS may revamp notifications.

item.title: SpaceX successfully launches four astronauts into orbit for ISS rendezvous
item.description: SpaceX has successfully launched four astronauts into orbit en route to the International Space Station (ISS) and stuck the landing with the Falcon 9's first stage booster.

item.title: Apple's 256GB MacBook Air M1 is down to an all-time low at Amazon
item.description: Apple's MacBook Air M1 is down to an all-time low price on Amazon for both the silver and space grey models with 256GB storage.

item.title: Sennheiser's Ambeo soundbar now supports Sony 360 Reality Audio
item.description: Sennheiser has rolled out a firmware update for the Ambeo soundbar, which brings Sony's 360 Reality Audio support to the device.

item.title: Watch SpaceX's first ISS astronaut launch with a reused Falcon rocket
item.description: SpaceX set for its second operational Crew Dragon mission (Crew-2) to launch four astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS) at 5:49 AM ET today.

item.title: CD Projekt Red made hundreds of millions on 'Cyberpunk 2077' despite the refunds
item.description: CD Projekt Red posted record-breaking revenue and sales numbers for the 2020 fiscal year, thanks to Cyberpunk 2077 — and despite the game's problematic release.

item.title: Snapchat now has more Android users than iOS
item.description: Snapchat continues to grow, thanks to an improved Android app and interest in its Spotlight feature.

item.title: 'Call of Duty: Warzone' season 3 update takes Verdansk to 1984
item.description: Season three of Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone kicks off today.

item.title: Twitch is adding threaded replies to chat
item.description: In an effort to make all of that chaos more manageable, Twitch is introducing threaded conversations.

item.title: Internal Facebook report finds the company bungled its 'Stop the Steal' response
item.description: Facebook missed several opportunities to crack down on the “Stop the Steal” movement that fueled the Jan. 6, insurrection at the U.S Capitol, according to an internal report obtained by BuzzFeed News.

item.title: Weather and news are coming to the Windows 10 taskbar
item.description: The tool creates a shortcut on the taskbar that allows you to check the weather, as well as catch up on the latest news, sports scores and stock prices.

item.title: Netflix recruits the Hype House's TikTok megastars for a reality show
item.description: Imagine 'The Real World' with social media influencers who already know each other.

item.title: Microsoft's Classroom Pen 2 is half the price of its predecessor
item.description: Modest design updates accompany the savings.

item.title: Facebook will ask users about ‘negative experiences’ in News Feed
item.description: Facebook will begin surveying users about the content in their News Feeds, including whether too much political content is contributing “negative experiences.”

item.title: YouTube makes it easier for creators to change channel name and profile picture
item.description: They can make the switch without affecting their Google account details.

item.title: Sony starts rolling out 1080p support for PlayStation Now
item.description: Support for 1080p streaming is finally coming to Sony's PlayStation Now service.

item.title: Sony picks up a multiplayer game from Bungie veterans
item.description: Firewalk Studios' first game will be a PS5 console exclusive.

item.title: Sony is already testing its PlayStation Plus Video Pass in Poland
item.description: Well, that was fast. Just one day after Sony accidentally shared an image promoting its new “PlayStation Plus Video Pass”, the company has confirmed that the feature is live and being publicly testing the feature right now. The only catch? You need to be in Poland to use it.

item.title: Twitter rolls out 4K image support on Android and iOS
item.description: Following a test the company ran in March, Twitter users on both iOS and Android can now upload and view images at 4K.

item.title: Google’s Fi wireless service gets a new, cheaper unlimited plan
item.description: Google’s Fi wireless service has always been a niche option that best served owners of Google Pixels, but today the search giant is adding a more affordable unlimited data plan in hopes of making Fi more palatable to the masses.
